data.text:
Amid #COVID19, misinformation can be deadly.

But all of us can do something about it: 

#PledgeToPause and take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation -- and the virus. https://t.co/q5ZFkROycf https://t.co/TMTJFHNk69

The UN has joined @expo2020dubai with exhibits & events showcasing our efforts to address some of the world's biggest problems.

Watch live as #GlobalGoals week kicks off with @AminaJMohammed in Dubai on Saturday at 9.30am EST: https://t.co/WhwXXmCYWf https://t.co/89QqIYYCNF

From Afghanistan to Syria and Yemen, @UNOCHA delivered life-saving assistance for millions of people caught up in crises last year. 

Details in the 2021 Year in Review: https://t.co/V5CBjqw7Ds #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/CpkZghweQK

The world needs vaccine equality for a sustainable #COVID19 recovery. 

#OnlyTogether will we end this pandemic.

More in @UNDESA's latest #WorldEconomyReport: https://t.co/ODBKe9wWrG https://t.co/uIWQAnNEWU

Every 2 weeks, the world loses an indigenous language and with it its entire cultural & intellectual heritage.

Indigenous languages matter - and must be protected. https://t.co/06C4Y8AWWz  #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/XQM76TEOpX

“What's still shocking to me is that we know. We can't claim ignorance or uncertainty about what's happening on climate. But yet, we're not doing enough.”

UN #ClimateAction Adviser @SelwinHart shares what keeps him 'Awake At Night' with @MelissaFleming. https://t.co/it3LJubKJT https://t.co/Rv5EtpaszK

Ethiopia:
"My appeal to the parties: stop the fighting in all its forms. All people who need humanitarian aid must receive it as quickly as possible. It’s time to start dialogue and reconciliation."
-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/Ldfg35i0as

Human trafficking happens in every country.
It is a violation of human rights & must be eradicated.

Refugees & other forcibly displaced people are particularly vulnerable. UNHCR is working to #EndHumanTrafficking: https://t.co/gTfvj7p2LE via @refugees 
https://t.co/tzdQsvONOT

No food, no fuel, no funding.

@WFP's work in northern Ethiopia is at risk of grinding to a halt as fighting blocks passage of food & fuel.

Due to lack of funding, WFP is also likely to run out of food & nutrition supplies for millions across the country.
https://t.co/dxI9j2qZq9 https://t.co/yShss88RiZ

Before food reaches our plates, it travels a long way. 

Our choices and actions can help that journey be more sustainable and achieve a better environment - and life - for all. 

We can all be food heroes. 

https://t.co/z4BLyjxMtw

From turning on computers, using AI software, to developing an argument, logic is ever-present in our daily lives. 

On Friday's World #LogicDay, @UNESCO explains how logic plays a key role in sustainable peace & development: https://t.co/XVnaWdGA9O https://t.co/JI1ybpg1yz

Extreme weather events, supercharged by the climate crisis, are affecting supply chains and causing prices to rise. 

@UNDESA's 2022 #WorldEconomyReport calls for urgent and coordinated #ClimateAction: https://t.co/ODBKe9fl36 https://t.co/F0tK23t8as

Racism affects us all and impacts entire societies. 

But some groups suffer more than others.

Learn about how you can #FightRacism and show solidarity with vulnerable groups. https://t.co/taxP3miHAy https://t.co/MEIrG3m0tx

🚌 Using public transport. 🚮 Reducing food waste. 🎽 Buying sustainable fashion. - Your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis. Chat with us over Facebook @Messenger to get more tips on how you can #ActNow to take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/SJ27YxkyEy https://t.co/rHiMkv2tI0

90,000+ men & women are #ServingForPeace in 12 @UNPeacekeeping missions worldwide. 

They come from different countries, cultures & backgrounds, but share a common purpose: to improve lives & promote peace around the world. https://t.co/1AkYG74EeJ https://t.co/GbvMuoW0V6

As I appeal to the international community to step up support for Afghans, I make an equally urgent plea to the Taliban leadership to recognize & protect fundamental human rights, in particular the rights of women & girls. 

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/VMpZa0clzB https://t.co/1XodNPFR2Y

Has the economy recovered from the pandemic?
Will prices continue to rise in 2022?
When will the jobs wiped out by #COVID19 come back?

Find out in @UNDESA's new #WorldEconomyReport: https://t.co/ODBKe9wWrG https://t.co/2k5vOcBJKf

"We need to act now to prevent economic & social collapse and find ways to prevent further suffering for millions of Afghans."

-- @antonioguterres appeals to the international community to step up support for the people of Afghanistan. https://t.co/nOU2HUGoQu https://t.co/PF33S6b1C3

You can't put out half a fire.

The same is true for tackling #COVID19: 
#OnlyTogether can we end this pandemic - by making vaccines accessible fairly around the world.

No one is safe until everyone is safe.

https://t.co/YiiqigpjdM

Sudan: With the crisis escalating, there have been 15 reports of attacks on healthcare workers & health facilities in the last two months alone - especially problematic amid #COVID19. 

Health workers & facilities are #NotATarget.
https://t.co/ZMpImfIpr2

We need more women leaders at the national and international levels for a better, more equal world.

See where your country stands on @UN_Women's Women in Politics map: https://t.co/b5Ecej0NhL https://t.co/duHVpn86c8

Reducing food loss & waste helps:
🍜 fight food insecurity,
🌎 protect precious resources,
👣 reduce our carbon footprint,
💰 save money & energy.

Tips on how you can reduce your food waste from @FAO: 
https://t.co/G6w0wFd1IW https://t.co/0oIbJZ0tww

"There is no sustainable long-term solution to be found on the battlefield."

-- UN Special Envoy @OSE_Yemen Hans Grundberg says genuine political will, responsible leadership & adherence to the interest of the entire population is needed to end conflict.
https://t.co/YkNNW2jG5s

Interested in working at the UN? 

The Young Professionals Programme is now open for applications through 13 February.

Get application tips & more from @UN_Careers: https://t.co/vSg7fYfjUZ https://t.co/o0PMwJaz0J

In South Sudan, peacekeepers from Pakistan have helped address the impacts of severe flooding.

Their vital work has protected civilians, airstrips, supply routes & more. Details from @UNMISSmedia: https://t.co/7lzvpfN8Ni #ServingForPeace https://t.co/7WiWRZoSGH

"The 2010 Haiti earthquake was a terrible disaster for the UN, Haiti & the world. I think that finding me as a survivor gave people hope. It was a light in the darkness. People were cheering."

-- @UNPeacekeeping's Jens Kristensen on Awake At Night with @MelissaFleming.

Volunteers make a positive impact on people's lives and help achieve the #GlobalGoals.

See how you can join @UNVolunteers and change the world for the better: https://t.co/m1h7Dcu6jY

 https://t.co/1FAzq4JTe2

Today we remember our friends, colleagues and all those who were killed twelve years ago in the 2010 Haiti earthquake.

We will never forget them. https://t.co/so6QFXAmxo https://t.co/lwBbIWjKbI

🚉 Using public transport
🚯 Reducing food waste
🎽 Buying sustainable fashion

Your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis: 

Chat with us over Facebook Messenger to get more tips on how you can #ActNow to take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/SJ27YxCa38 https://t.co/CtOOTrCL56

Wednesday marks 12 years since hundreds of thousands of people lost their lives in the 2010 Haiti earthquake, among them, 102 of our colleagues & friends. 

We remember them today & always. https://t.co/gTPOb7IH25 https://t.co/ALZ7z2fldb

Mali: “Insecurity has expanded, the humanitarian situation has deteriorated, more children are of out of school & the country has been affected by an endless cycle of instability.”  

-- @UN_MINUSMA head @elghassimw to Security Council. https://t.co/AxMBcSjBmx

Following a strong rebound in 2021, global economy is now entering slowdown amid threats from #COVID19 variants & rise in inflation, debt & income inequality, @WorldBank finds.

https://t.co/4wgGjWyKH9

Afghanistan faces one of the world’s most acute humanitarian crises.

The UN & partners have launched plans to deliver aid to 22 million people in Afghanistan & 5.7 million more requiring help beyond the country's borders. https://t.co/2QgnSpOQUJ https://t.co/otIOHGE1iG

Peacekeepers in Cyprus started the new year donating blood to support those in need - just one example of how the men & women of @UNPeacekeeping are #ServingForPeace around the world.

More on the work of @UN_CYPRUS: https://t.co/fZXHldOtr2 https://t.co/8cBU6vW3SL

From #COVID19 to the climate crisis, #OnlyTogether will we succeed at battling global challenges this year. 

See how @UNDP will continue their work on #ClimateAction,  poverty eradication and the #GlobalGoals in 2022: https://t.co/Yyjwt7ydRq https://t.co/lTpE3rgUi3

Resurgence of coups d'état is a consequence of being "completely out of step with the aspirations of populations," @UN_UNOWAS chief tells Security Council, reiterating support for strengthening peace & stability in West Africa & the Sahel. https://t.co/UsXVKBvEc9 https://t.co/STdWOv2dfX

Bangladesh: Twice last week, fire swept through a crowded Rohingya refugee camp leaving many without shelter or food.

The UN is working on providing food, protection, water, sanitation & other support to those affected.
https://t.co/jEbeki5rXv

To #FightRacism, fair access to justice for all is essential. This means:
🔹 Ending impunity for acts of racism
🔹 Ensuring equal access to legal assistance & justice for victims
🔹 Stopping the spread of ideas based on racial superiority or hatred

https://t.co/cCd3JjLrsV https://t.co/GxtZHNLAYv

UN Deputy Secretary-General @AminaJMohammed will continue in her role for another 5 years, @antonioguterres formally announced on Monday, praising her effective leadership in advancing the #GlobalGoals & protecting the #ParisAgreement on #ClimateAction.
https://t.co/EnH2o6UdFR https://t.co/YmaZPPPO7i

Ethiopia: Ongoing conflict and recent airstrikes on camps for internally displaced people & refugees have forced some UN agencies to suspend aid.

The UN and humanitarian partners are urging an immediate cessation of hostilities. 
https://t.co/wrY2XBJ8Sl

"Keep speaking out.
Keep identifying the solutions & actions we need to recover."

-- @antonioguterres at World Youth Forum, urging leaders to look to young people as a source of innovative solutions and to put their needs first. 
https://t.co/qYjTWYdPea

Abuse is not always physical and it doesn’t always leave visible scars.

Each of us can help protect women & girls:

📣 Speak out to break the cycle of abuse
⚖️ Support survivors & their right to justice
❌ Stop victim blaming 

https://t.co/9DkJpsxvFB via @UN_Women https://t.co/I7bhEcTuxI

1 in 3 students worldwide has been the victim of bullying, which can have serious impacts on children’s mental health.

@UNESCO has more facts about the risks of school violence & bullying: https://t.co/3QpkXD4PVJ https://t.co/ibFptZ0AIO

Women & girls continue to be disproportionately affected by #COVID19 and other global crises, exacerbating pre-existing gender norms and inequalities.

Gender based violence has also intensified, giving rise to a shadow pandemic.

More from @UNOCHA: https://t.co/ugSfNY8QM3

"It's time to go into emergency mode. The climate battle is the fight of our lives & that fight must be won," @antonioguterres said after #COP26.

Chat with us over Facebook Messenger for ideas on how YOU can take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/mezgw4kocS https://t.co/ZorDGJhPwA

#COVID19 has led to the first rise in extreme poverty in 20 years.

Ending poverty in all its forms is about leaving no one behind and ensuring all people, everywhere, can live a life of dignity. https://t.co/xhDC9tQEd6 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/WIpU6uYTzZ

➡️Seeking asylum is a human right.
➡️Getting an education is a human right.
➡️Having a nationality is a human right.
➡️Being together with family is a human right.

More on what it means to seek asylum. https://t.co/zuuZD22oO5 via @Refugees https://t.co/TxiVCgUnTI

Education is a human right, not a privilege.

Join @UNESCO & #StandUp4HumanRights to ensure everyone, everywhere can access quality education. https://t.co/pKrL6R16vt https://t.co/ix9stwddlg

Including women in mediation efforts & decision-making can help create more sustainable peace.

Greater efforts are needed to ensure women's voices are heard in peace processes. https://t.co/JlWYyF80DR via @UNPeacekeeping https://t.co/Rcl1jY5LXM

If social media has ever made you feel anxious, know that you’re not alone.

Check out these useful tips from @UNICEF on looking after your mental health and being kind online. #OnMyMind

https://t.co/Goiov0V4MC

Escalating conflict, rising food insecurity, the climate crisis & #COVID19 are exacerbating the humanitarian situation in the Sahel.

@UNOCHA has 10 facts you need to know about the deteriorating situation in the region. https://t.co/YJvQtX2yVs

In Kenya, where many are experiencing vaccine hesitancy, @UNICEF has partnered with religious leaders to help spread the word about the importance of vaccinations to stop the spread of #COVID19 and end the pandemic. https://t.co/1EyFwUxZmL

From driving less to saving electricity, from reducing food waste to recycling -- your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis.

Chat with us over Facebook @Messenger for more tips on how to take #ClimateAction to help protect people & planet. https://t.co/SJ27YxCa38 https://t.co/gV5jTNnJAw

The spread of misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can be dangerous.

❌ Don't share rumours.
✅ Choose content verified by reliable sources.

#PledgetoPause and check the facts before sharing content online. https://t.co/qFqoh7loX2 https://t.co/7Cbc4IrNVZ

When girls & young women miss out on their right to education, the impact on communities lasts for generations.

More on the vital importance of inclusive & equitable education for all: https://t.co/KnCtlYzGUH #GlobalGoals https://t.co/iWRAyxpZHq

Personal care products are a major source of microplastics in our oceans.

Small changes to our daily habits can have a big impact for #CleanSeas.

From bamboo toothbrushes to plastic free cosmetics, @UNEP has ideas about how you can #BeatPlasticPollution: https://t.co/6imkVPuYfa https://t.co/iSyzz9z0rz

The impacts of the climate crisis are all around us, and we need to #ActNow to address the emergency. 

2022 is a crucial year for #ClimateAction.
https://t.co/T382qoWjkS

“If we don’t put out the bushfires, we’re doomed.”

Refugees in Mauritania are part of a volunteer fire brigade that is battling the impacts of the climate crisis to protect lives & livelihoods. 

More on their efforts & how @Refugees is supporting them. https://t.co/eiZDYp2ZiR

When and how is a new @UNPeacekeeping operation formed?

The Security Council decides on new missions and their mandates. Get more details here: https://t.co/yS5VxBxyfr https://t.co/ZtaTXHUbpV

"The vaccines that are available for #COVID19 work against all variants."

Vaccines are a critical tool for fighting the pandemic, says @mvankerkhove, as @WHO reiterates call for vaccine equity to help bring the crisis to an end. https://t.co/82JmXRgYhJ https://t.co/IHzmuMvFvY

The #TrollsFoodHeroes have teamed up with the UN to help build a more sustainable world.

You can join them & take #ClimateAction by reducing your food waste: 
🗓 Plan your meals
🥙 Eat leftovers
❄️ Freeze excess food
🌱 Compost

More ways to #ActNow: https://t.co/dDZ0DfgqGw https://t.co/9Kv7W79pe8

It's a #SnowDay at UNHQ in NYC, but no matter the weather or conditions, our work continues around the world for everyone, everywhere: responding to #COVID19, preventing conflict, taking #ClimateAction & much more. https://t.co/IUYTNM5eVG https://t.co/kvkepHuh5x

Philippines: The UN has launched a $107 million appeal to support recovery efforts following Super Typhoon Rai, which wreaked devastation across the country.

@WFP warns people are facing nutrition & food insecurity in the hardest hit areas. https://t.co/pQ2EcpTdcs

The climate crisis affects everyone. 
But it doesn't affect everyone the same. 

Climate impacts can lead to more gender-based violence, child marriages & pregnancy complications, increasing gender inequalities. 

Get the facts from @UNFPA: https://t.co/EuO0Q3lHMl #ClimateAction https://t.co/IPrytwQv6p

"Moments of great difficulty are also moments of great opportunity."

As the new year gets underway, @antonioguterres is encouraging people around the world to come together in solidarity and unite behind solutions that can benefit everyone. https://t.co/PnUOkcYDwi https://t.co/VuH6dXyEVN

More than 300,000 women die from cervical cancer every year. 

Yet, the disease can be prevented through vaccinations, regular screenings & treatment. 

More from @WHO during January's cervical cancer awareness month: https://t.co/S7tbyd1wqn https://t.co/cm4vgFG1wk

Kazakhstan: Amid violence in the country, @UNHumanRights chief @MBachelet urges security forces, protesters and all others, to refrain from violence and seek a peaceful resolution to current tensions. https://t.co/cp7OiySMIK

55 journalists and media professionals were killed globally last year -- and many more faced imprisonment, physical attacks and intimidation. 

@UNESCO says, now more than ever, we need to protect those who bring us independent, factual information. https://t.co/FwH2WCpfBh

"It's time to go into emergency mode. The climate battle is the fight of our lives & that fight must be won," @antonioguterres said after #COP26.

@UNEP explains how #ClimateAction will be a top priority in the coming year. https://t.co/H8583hJZCJ

📷: The "Knotted Gun" sculpture is an inspirational symbol of non-violence. 

This iconic work of art is one of many such pieces that depict the principles of peace & solidarity at UNHQ in NYC. https://t.co/03Ukc1YIh7 https://t.co/Mnb0n44mrE

#COVID19 has put the mental health & well-being of children & young people at risk. The impact on families could linger for years.

@UNICEF is calling for urgent support & more investment in mental health services. https://t.co/sTmgwykkbu #OnMyMind https://t.co/D64JfwkgyF

More than 28 million people are acutely food insecure in West and Central Africa due to ongoing conflicts and the climate crisis -- the largest number since 2014.

@UNOCHA says more support is needed to ensure the situation does not further deteriorate. https://t.co/aPaOVA7xcT

The #TrollsFoodHeroes have joined forces with the UN to help build a more sustainable world.

By eating all kinds fruits & vegetables – including "ugly" ones – you can improve your health & help reduce food waste. 🍊🫐🥕🥦 

More ways you can #ActNow: https://t.co/dDZ0DfgqGw https://t.co/ihU12ZFedY

Threats against journalists are threats against fundamental freedoms.

More must be done to #EndImpunity for crimes against journalists.

https://t.co/cdZ8yTLTtM via @UNESCO https://t.co/UDOXTn3YU9

Afghanistan: Harsh winter conditions are compounding the ongoing humanitarian crisis impacting millions in the country.

@UNOCHA and humanitarian partners are racing against time and the elements to deliver aid and supplies to those in need. https://t.co/bt9nB2OPod

"Together, let’s make recovery our resolution for 2022.

For people, planet and prosperity."

As the new year got underway, @antonioguterres shared a message of hope with the world. https://t.co/NP2jgkVf67

Ending racism, discrimination, xenophobia and intolerance is our shared responsibility.

Every one of us can act to end hatred. 

Here's how you can take action to #FightRacism: https://t.co/PWxqEMS8La https://t.co/lyrOaroVbu

Photographers from around the world were invited to capture the power of human rights through images.📸

Get inspired to #StandUp4HumanRights through their work. https://t.co/nr3cTLc8Cf

In Pakistan, a first-ever initiative to verify data for 1.4 million Afghan refugees has ended.

Smart identity cards have been issued, providing fast & secure access to health, education & financial services. via @Refugees https://t.co/eLyLyQSXRz

Clean energy is good business: 
It drives more jobs, cleaner air & better health.

A swift transition to sustainable energy is critically important to tackle the global climate crisis. https://t.co/MWhGAcRudh #ClimateAction https://t.co/2n3pocIlQr

Climate crisis 🌳
Nature & biodiversity loss 🐦🐟
Pollution & waste 🌊

@UNEP's 50th anniversary is an opportunity for collective action & cooperation to protect our planet & all its people. https://t.co/NA4brXjOAv #UNEP50 https://t.co/PEpWr1ypLP

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for the future. 

Our survival on this planet hinges on these few degrees.

Addressing the climate crisis & limiting temperature rise is possible, if we #ActNow. https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y via @UNFCCC https://t.co/NxQMdZBmnC

In 2021, only one woman was awarded the #NobelPrize.  

Strong women can help inspire strong girls - and together - we can all help achieve #GenerationEquality. https://t.co/QQRFPY4VRn via @UN_Women https://t.co/y7kf2sgO5t

As Omicron surges around the world, it is crucial that all countries receive lifesaving #COVID19 vaccines as quickly as possible.

Every effort must be made to get 70% of the world's population vaccinated by mid-2022, says @WHO. https://t.co/XGRlT9Pv1T

Afghanistan: As winter sets in, 23 million people are facing severe hunger.
 
@WFP teams are working to bring food and supplies to those most vulnerable. 

You can support their lifesaving efforts: https://t.co/dBYTAjgNqa

https://t.co/fnhFoehdCk

#COVID19 has highlighted the importance of making essential information accessible to all. 

On Tuesday's #WorldBrailleDay, see how the UN helps promote Braille as a means of communication. https://t.co/e93Cr6egxn https://t.co/mhORhzgOA6

More women in science can help end the pandemic and bring about solutions to some of the most challenging problems facing humanity today.

@UN_Women is working for #GenerationEquality around the world! https://t.co/9DkJpsxvFB https://t.co/RCC9MzQpkA

Braille is an essential means of communication for blind & partially-sighted people - and can help achieve the #GlobalGoals. 

Tuesday is #WorldBrailleDay: https://t.co/sO1ETiESqd https://t.co/SjYT5EbOPg

The #TrollsFoodHeroes teamed up with the UN to mobilize action for a healthy diet & sustainable living.

🍊🫐🥕🥦

From eating more fruits & vegetables to buying local & seasonal produce, to wasting less food, all of us can #ActNow for people & planet. https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo https://t.co/8qL85Evakg
On Tuesday's #WorldBrailleDay, see how Braille helps blind and partially-sighted people realize their full human rights. https://t.co/sO1ETiESqd https://t.co/MAWiX8rh0H

In every language & every nation, people are calling for urgent #ClimateAction to address the devastating impacts of the climate crisis.

We must #ActNow to protect our planet: https://t.co/j7cZVZf9ox https://t.co/g5Qu6KEMaf

The only way to get through #COVID19 is to work together in solidarity, as one human family. 

Together, we can get through the pandemic.
Together, we can build a better world. https://t.co/bOVSX51F0D

The #GlobalGoals are our blueprint to achieve a better & more sustainable world.

Learn more about the 17 Goals created to transform our future. https://t.co/Ss4uMcXdcV https://t.co/dDeUsAFF38

Racism, discrimination and xenophobia harm us all.

But everyone, everywhere can take action to spread compassion, tolerance and acceptance.

Get ideas about how YOU can help #FightRacism. https://t.co/cCd3Jk32kt https://t.co/fkFYcBY45e

Climate change is a menace to our world. 

Our league of superheroes is taking #ClimateAction and they want YOU to join them! 

Get to know them all and find out how you can #ActNow: https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 https://t.co/X8G8CV7mIH

We need gender equality to achieve the #GlobalGoals and a better world for all. 

@UN_Women has tips on how you can become part of #GenerationEquality. https://t.co/sE79GHL1Qq https://t.co/Hkv5z7sJNx

Misinformation is dangerous and is hampering our ability to make progress on global issues.

We can all take action now. #PledgeToPause & take time to verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/qFqoh7CZOA https://t.co/Sc6aBefS86
